data.content:
verb
poaches; poached; poaching
[+ obj] to cook (something) in a small amount of liquid that is almost boiling
The vegetables were poached in chicken broth.
to cook (an egg without its shell) in boiling water or in a small cup over boiling water
poach an egg - compare 2poach
verb
poaches; poached; poaching
to hunt or fish illegally :to catch or kill an animal illegally [+ obj]
Elephants are often poached for their ivory tusks. [no obj]
The state fines anyone who is caught poaching.
[+ obj] :to take (something, such as an idea, or someone, such as an employee or customer) from someone else illegally or unfairly
She was accused of poaching [=plagiarizing] the material for her essay from a Web site.
Her former company accused her of poaching clients. - compare 1poach
poach on someone's territory/turf
to do something that someone else should do :to interfere in an area that another person usually controls
You can't keep other candidates from poaching on your turf. [=from trying to get voters who usually vote for you or your party to vote for them]

Danh từ
việc câu trộm, việc săn bắn trộm
